Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band- or lip-cup; interior glazed black; exterior glaze fired red-brown: incised handle zone palmette from left side of handle; glazed zone below.
Curator's comments: Compare the handle palmettes of the Taleides Painter, c. 550/540 BC (Heesen 2011, 246, no. 124).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 418, no. B650)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0535) (Phase 1)
